learning_outcomes: I can determine which ML and DL modules are installed at a center
I can run a Python code that uses PyTorch
I can run a Python code that uses TensorFlow
I am comfortable using a Python book
I can write a batch script that uses GPUs
I know the basics of using the different parallelization tools in Python
I can make a plot with Seaborn
I can use Pandas (basic operations - statistics, binary operators, vectorized math, string methods)
I can use Pandas (inspect, clean, and sort data for later operations)
I can load a Python (machine learning) module
I know how a simple for loop can be parallelized with Multiprocessing and how it can run on multiple cores
I can use Pandas (input/output Pandas data)
I can write a batch script
I can check that I am in an interactive session
I can decide on useful file formats for big data
I can use a text editor on my HPC cluster
I can use the compute nodes interactively
I can submit a script to the job scheduler
I am comfortable using the documentation of my HPC center
I can work (create, activate, work, deactivate) with a venv virtual environment
I can create plots in matplotlib
I can determine if a Python package is installed
I can use a Python IDE
I can describe what the Python interpreter is
I can run a Python script that uses a graphical library on an HPC cluster
I can find and load a Python package module
I can install Python packages
I can read and write to/from a file in Python
I am comfortable learning Python
I can convert a simple equation to Python code
I can convert a simple text question to Python code
I can create a Python script
I can create and use a variable in Python
I can load a Python version on my HPC cluster
I can run a Python script
